poem:
In the Halls of Power

With a swift wind,  
titles shift,  
Cooper's voice will bridge seas,  
while Lammy stands  
in Starmer's shadow—  
two hands guiding  
porcelain futures,  
reshuffled like cards  
in a drawn-out game.  
England waits,  
holding its breath,  
and I—  
in the morning light,  
watch potential unfold  
like petals—to bloom  
or wilt.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Yvette Cooper to become foreign secretary and David Lammy deputy PM, say No 10 sources Yvette Cooper is to become the UK’s new foreign secretary, Downing Street sources have said, as Keir Starmer embarks on a sweeping reshuffle after the damaging departure of his deputy, Angela Rayner, from government. David Lammy was to become justice secretary, they added, but would also be appointed deputy prime minister, meaning the move is a promotion for the veteran". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Yvette Cooper to become foreign secretary and David Lammy deputy PM, say No 10 sources Yvette Cooper is to become the UK’s new foreign secretary, Downing Street sources have said, as Keir Starmer embarks on a sweeping reshuffle after the damaging departure of his deputy, Angela Rayner, from government.
